e4: Switching to the new policy will enhance ethical transparency, revealing truthful EPS figures and aligning with legal standards, reducing potential scrutiny from regulatory bodies. Though there may be confusion initially due to ingrained perceptions, clear investor communication will facilitate understanding. Being truthful strengthens investor trust long term, outweighing short-term interpretative challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy and transparency, offering truthful and unbiased financial reports. It should inform stakeholders completely and fairly, without deliberate alterations that could shield reality. Compliance with regulatory and legal standards is essential to prevent fraud. Considering disclosures about changes to reduce misconceptions is crucial, offering equitable treatment and protect vulnerable investor groups from any potentially misleading practice, ensuring every investor operates with the same level of knowledge.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to effectively communicate the policy change to both sophisticated and retail investors, ensuring understanding across all groups. Further, I would inquire about potential strategies for handling any initial market reactions and monitoring the shift's impact on investor perception and company reputation.
